Posts.Content: Hi Julie and mistymoley Thankyou for your replies yes waiting is the pits and I seem to get more anxious the longer it goes on haven't had a break from it all my family are going through so much mum and sister have tested pos for the brca2 mutation so everything is getting the better of me because my head is full of all the c**p this thing throws at you. I have made steps to seek counselling ive been in touch with cancer support at local hospital but I do so much want try and get some sense of calm I have been prescribed some anti depressants but I'm not ready take them. The only reason I had Mri was a pre op scan for healthy side as I'm having further preventative surgery I didn't think it would open a can of worms I thought the chemo had worked just thinking all sorts. Julie I hope your scan is ok I had a bone scan too and that came back ok. Thanks again x
Posts.Title: Cannot move forward

Posts.Content: Hi all Not been in here for a while I got diagnosed in November last year been a whirlwind since then had masectomy chemo rads which finished June this year then told I had brca2 mutation recently had Mri to gear up other surgery which showed breast area clear but right lung had an intedeterminate focal area I am in melt down they don't know what it is and ive got to have a ct scan now I have been positive but I feel ready to crack now it's one thing after another haven't had a break or felt one bit myself since diagnosis just feel so lost cannot move forward as there's always a step bac
Posts.Title: Cannot move forward

Posts.Content: Well been whirlwind and still is a whirlwind Ct came back and still none the wiser 4 professionals had a meeting oncologist radiologist surgeon lung specialist and they all coming to the conclusion that it's inflammation but ive got to have a follow up scan in 1st November to see if it's changed has anyone else experienced this my oncologist says it's rare but I said how many people have follow up scans after treatment ?? He said its not usual practice so if I wasn't going down further surgery route I would have been none the wiser so fed up with worry
Posts.Title: Cannot move forward

Posts.Content: Hi mo I know exactly how you feel I had my 1st docetaxel nearly three weeks ago still not feel right having 2nd lot fri should be if bloods ok I'm meeting for my review in Thursday so will see what they say about the dosage but it's really knocked me about. I sailed through fec so I reckon it's the docetaxel that's taken a dislike to me x
Posts.Title: docetaxel has floored me

Posts.Content: To all you ladies who have finished chemo big congrats you have done it .. I'm half way can't wait for the finish line xxxxx clare
Posts.Title: Thursday/Friday chemo kitties

Posts.Content: I think I need a chemo twin so we can cross the finish line together x
Posts.Title: Thursday/Friday chemo kitties

Posts.Content: Hi ladies I can relate to how you feeling today like you said I think a lot of ladies are feeling the same. I only heard this morning about Rios wife such a shame and only 34 then bam could not get the incentive to move out of bed for a while but I thought got to move and fight on. I will record the c word I dont think I am ready to watch it just yet ️xx stay positive
Posts.Title: Feeling down today ....

Posts.Content: Maggie may Thats made me smile I fancy being a rebel too xxx
Posts.Title: Feeling down today ....

Posts.Content: Hi ladies I'm due to start chemo very soon and wanted some feedback on the benefits Manuka honey and also vitamin d3 if any?? Thanks Clare xx
Posts.Title: Manila honey & vitamin d3

Posts.Content: Thanks guys for your reply. Holland and Barrett trip it is then .. Happy new year to all xxx clare
Posts.Title: Manila honey & vitamin d3

Posts.Content: Maggie May/clogheen Hiya I read that she was in remission for 9 months then it unfortunately it came back in her bones it says she passed away 2 months later how true that is I'm not sure it was on the daily mail xxx clare
Posts.Title: Feeling down today ....

Posts.Content: Hi all 4th treatment done 1st tax felt like crap just hit rock bottom today thinking how far I come already just can't face much more. Fed up of not doing what I want to do going where I want to go and missing work so much never ever thought I would say that just want my life back although I know it won't be the same just different I know I'm not alone got a fantastic family network I feel guilty when I look at my two girlies when I feel like this they try do much to make things better. I think its because it's Easter and we are normally out and about but instead I'm in pain and feeling sorry for myself xx
Posts.Title: Hit a brick wall

Posts.Content: Hi ladies. .had masectomy on 25th to right side with skin sparing reconstruction using implant and strattice. .been to see the consultant today and booom necrosis has started to set in where incision is lower breast. Im so upset he has advised me to come back on Wednesday morning to evaluate and then take action. I still have my drain in and just wanted anyone elses experience of this and what other options were available. .ive felt angry and just thought have the implant out and be done with then I can concentrate on my treatment which is now going to be delayed X
Posts.Title: strattice implant failure

Posts.Content: Hey ladies hope you all doing ok Well today has been a mixture of emotions I had my 5th tax last Friday had the lowered dose as suffering from bad se I made an appointment with my gp because I've not been sleeping very well and thought he might be able to give me something to help me sleep. I was in with him for half an hour he I just crumbled in there I don't even know why I ended up pouring my heart out to him so not only have I come away with something to help me sleep but an antidepressant which I'm not convinced I need to take. It's like a time bomb has gone off and I can't stop crying I'm sure I'm not alone here I thought I was doing well. It's a bitch all this we have to go through so much xx
Posts.Title: Today has been a blurrrr

Posts.Content: Thx Maggie May ive been so strong I think it's catching up with me xxx
Posts.Title: Today has been a blurrrr

Posts.Content: Thanku ladies Other than obviously going through hell ive coped quite well I am now thinking my hormones are all over the place also as my periods have stopped this cycle and Im having hot sweats this is interrupting my sleep I've heard about a magic magnet that can help with this has anyone brought one ?? Xx
Posts.Title: Today has been a blurrrr

Posts.Content: Thx George for the reply I'm asthmatic too I think I will call them see what they say x
Posts.Title: Tickle cough

Posts.Content: Hi ladies hope you are doing ok.. Just wanted to pick your brains?? I had first dose of fec 10 days ago Im ok but have developed a tickly cough just wondered if anyone else had experienced this and if it's one of many side effects..I feel ok temp fine xx happy sunday
Posts.Title: Tickle cough

Posts.Content: Hi mistymoley Yes I'm flat now still got skin just left don't know if it will be ok left need see consultant tomorrow so will ask more.. I felt rushed yesterday supposed to be going for wound check and I was admitted then operated on all in the space of a couple of hours.. The reconstruction I had was using the strattice method they said that it was taking probably due to infection behind it .. I've got a lot of questions tomorrow don't really know what my options are til then .. I need think about getting back to feeling ok til I take on anything else didn't want delay treatment really xx
Posts.Title: After 6 weeks implant removed

Posts.Content: well ladies im exhausted had 3 operations in 6 weeks first 25/11 right side mascetomy with immediate construction 9/12 wound debridment 7/1 implant removed healimg problems.. I'm so down I wish I hadn't had immediate construction if I knew the outcome.. Feeling low self esteem and not good about myself and I haven't started treatment yet they want start next week but I dont feel physically or mentally prepared body been through so much already in a short period of time... Sorry for the rant just wondering if anyone had a similar experience ..
Posts.Title: After 6 weeks implant removed

Posts.Content: Hi all hope everyone having a good day . I've not been on here for a while I always pop in and read some of the discussions but not posted in a while. I'm 7 months post treatment diagnosed Nov 14 had mastectomy chemo and rads trying to get on with my life but finding it so hard to find the energy to exercise don't know if I'm trying too hard it's so frustrating when I can't do things I really want to do especially horse riding finding it exhausting  my heart rate is through the roof and feel dizzy . I'm having an ecg later as have explained symptoms to gp could it be effects of chemotherapy had an effect on the heart it would this have shown up earlier? Just wondering if anyone else had a similar experience xx
Posts.Title: Frustrated lack of energy

Posts.Content: Hi all you wealth of knowledge people Just wondering whether anyone had taken barleygrass whilst being on chemothereapy and is there an adverse effect went in Holland & Barrett for my supply of Manuka and the lady in the store was raving about it x
Posts.Title: Barleygrass

Posts.Content: Crystaljuju Im holding onto that thought one more to go can't wait to feel the relief you did x
Posts.Title: Barleygrass

Posts.Content: Thanx crystal juju I'm just trying to see what works I'm going try and stick to healthy things although some days I just crave rubbish one more tax to go I can do it xxx
Posts.Title: Barleygrass

Posts.Content: Hi rebecca its a scary time isn't it..I was diagnosed in Nov ive had two surgeries I opted for a mastectomy to my right breast with immediate reconstruction then had to go in again because the wound wasn't healing properly. Itis a roller coaster of emotions but you have the support of all these lovely ladies on here who are in the same situation and can offer advice and support. I think the waiting is the worst. Im meeting with my oncologist on 2nd to discuss treatment then at least I know what the plan is. Hope all goes we on Tuesday remember there is always someone you can offload to. Hugs clare xx
Posts.Title: The unknown

Posts.Content: Hey Wynn 1 glad your planning your spa day.. I need plan something myself so I can see light at the end of the tunnel ️xx hang in there clare
Posts.Title: 3rd fec half way

Posts.Content: Hi helen Yes I get the hangover feeling and it usually last 2/3 days I just keep drinking as much as I can and flushing it through its a horrible feeling though isn't it x well done on getting through your first fec your on a roll now hugs Clare x
Posts.Title: 3rd fec half way

Posts.Content: Hi shaz how u doing yes the waiting is torture isn't it ️xx tips well some of these lovely ladies have give me a few which I will share .. Manuka honey start taking it asap it great for mouth ulcers and boosting your immune system I started with 10+ and up to 15+ now it's expensive but I feel it works . Drink the toxins out of your system... Try sucking on ice lollies when your mouth feels furry take the anti sickness meds even if you feel ok... Be kind to your body rest when you can...it's a journey I'm half way through mine it isn't easy I'm not going to lie but you can do it x clare
Posts.Title: 3rd fec half way

Posts.Content: hey ladies n gents how you all doing?? I had 3rd fec Friday feeling pants but fec done moving onto tax next oh God ive heard some wonderful things about fecs sister xxxx
Posts.Title: 3rd fec half way

Posts.Content: Hi everyone kids with bugs ehh no escape ️xx thank you for the replies I will just keep checking for symptoms and hope for the best. The oncology team don't seem too concerned as I know I've had chicken pox when I was younger these things are sent to test us aren't they love n hugs Clare x
Posts.Title: Chicken pox

Posts.Content: Hi blue roan I find your blog inspiring and I'm going to add a few extras to my diet to try and improve my blood count ️xx I also share your enthusiasm for horses and would love get back in the saddle after this is all done ️xx Clare
Posts.Title: Massive Improvements!

Posts.Content: My daughter has chicken pox oh great I rang the unit and got to keep an eye on things because of the chemo I'm having but I've had chicken pox I should be immune yes ??? Xx
